description:
The Google Policy team's mission is to promote a positive experience for users, advertisers, partners and Googlers. You help work toward this goal by developing and implementing fair and consistent policies and by protecting the online safety of our users. We balance freedom of expression, access to information, brand impact and user experience to transform Google's principles into fair and consistent guidelines for our users' content and behavior on our products. The policy team is responsible for developing and launching new policies, serving as the policy expert on cross-functional teams on policy implementation and consultation. You collaborate with a wide-range of stakeholders, from engineers to sales managers to attorneys, working with them to reach consensus on policy issues. You develop content policies, support training and escalations for the policies after product launch and build expertise in areas like Internet hate speech and online cyberbullying. You have strong leadership, communication, project management and interpersonal skills.

Global Product Policy, part of Google's Trust and Safety team, develops policies that help improve user experiences across a wide variety of Google products including Google Ads, Search, Assistant, Geo, Cloud and more. We're driven by our focus on the user and passion for using our technical, legal, business and policy knowledge to improve Google's policies and user experience. We advise Google on core principles and also drive and manage complex projects.

In this role, you will work on everything from what sort of ads are allowed on Google's network to ensuring Google's Search results features informative and relevant content. Your role will be cross-functional and global and will require you to work closely with Product, Engineering, Legal, Public Policy, PR, Enforcement and other teams within Trust and Safety, across Google and around the world.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • JD, MBA or Master’s degree
  • Experience with the technologies underlying the Internet and web, including networking architecture, web markup and scripting languages, online advertising technology, database systems, and machine learning.
  • Experience with advanced product and/or program management.
  • Experience with policy, combined with knowledge of the technology sector and the key policy issues affecting the internet (e.g. intellectual property, free expression and online safety).
  • Experience using data and technology to solve complex business problems coupled with a proven ability to exercise judgment even in a crisis.
  • Ability to translate complex issues into simple, clear language. Ability to work collaborative with a wide variety of cross-functional stakeholders and navigate organizational boundaries.
responsibilities:
• Collaborate with Product Managers, Trust & Safety (T&S) teams and Engineering to influence and guide product development, decisions and prioritization, and improve user experience with respect to policy-related issues.
  • Drive awareness and understanding of our product policies within Google and across our user base. Advance education around the first principles that define our positions on topics such as hate speech, bullying, minor protection, safety, security, developer guidelines and privacy.
  • Collaborate with a cross-functional team to develop and implement policies for Google products, with a view towards user safety, product quality and privacy.
  • Advance education and conversations around best practices in the digital content policy space.
  • Resolve high-profile policy escalations from users and internal stakeholders
title: Policy Advisor, Global Product Policy
